maml:description.maml:para: Convert a Gxx bitstream to text
Options for the Conversion. Cf. New-FloppyDiskImageConfiguration
Convert a bitstream to flux format
Use a high resolution extension of P64
The data to insert into a template which should be a Dxx image.
Inserts specific data into templates to create a textual resprentation of a bitstream
The detector for getting the bitcell size. Cf. New-FloppyDiskImageConfiguration
Assume speedzones returned by speed detector are commodore 8250 speed zones when decoding flux
The number of identical revolutions to store inside the generated image
A 4 character string to store inside the header of the format. In case of "8050", "8250" abd "1001", flux resoltion is the one of the commodore 8250.
Converts textual representation of bitstream back to bitstream
A 4 character string to store inside the header of the format. In case of "8050", "8250" abd "1001", flux resoltion is the one of the commodore 8250.
Converts multi revolution dumps to single revolution representation
Use a high resolution extension of P64
An object which decides which rotation that is stored into the image is used.
A 4 character string to store inside the header of the format. In case of "8050", "8250" abd "1001", flux resoltion is the one of the commodore 8250.
Converts multi revolution dumps to single revolution representation
Use a high resolution extension of P64
The data to insert into a template which should be a Dxx image.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-FloppyDiskImage -Bitstream -Filename disk.g64 | >> Convert-FloppyDiskImage -BitstreamToText | >> Export-FloppydiskImage -TextualRepresentation -Filename disk.g64.txt

dev:remarks.maml:para: Converts the disk.g64 to its textual representation and saves it as disk.g64.txt

maml:description.maml:para: Exports an object representation of a floppy disk image to a file.
Exports an object representation of a floppy disk image to a file.
The first parameter should always be the switch parameter selecting the output format (bitstream, sector image, flux, ...).
The image object to export is provided via a format-specific parameter and can also be passed through the pipeline.
Note: This cmdlet does not convert images between formats. The exported format must match the input format.
The bitstream image object to export.
Selects bitstream image export (G64, G71, G81, ...).
Currently required for many existing G64 and G71 images. Subject to change.
Writes the GCM identifier instead of GCR into the Gxx header.
The flux image object to export.
The SCP image object to export.
The textual representation of bitstream to export.
Selects export of a textual bitstream representation.
The bitstream image object to export.
Selects bitstream image export (G64, G71, G81, ...).
The flux image object to export.
The textual representation of bitstream to export.
Selects export of a textual bitstream representation.
The SCP image object to export.
Currently required for many existing G64 and G71 images. Subject to change.
Writes the GCM identifier instead of GCR into the Gxx header.

maml:description.maml:para: Reads a Floppy disk image from disk and returns it as an object.
Reads a floppy disk image from disk and returns it as an object.
The first parameter should always be the switch parameter selecting the format (bitstream, sector image, flux, ...).
In most cases, the second parameter is the filename. For KryoFlux images, this can be replaced by a basename. For empty (unformatted) sector images, the filename can be omitted.
Sector images additionally require the SectorImageType parameter.
Sets the name excluding "00.0.raw" for kryoflux image.
Tells the system you want to read a kryoflux image. You'll get a FLuxDump object.
Specifies sides to read for kryoflux image.
Tells the cmdlet you want to read bitstream images, that is G64, G71, G81, ... files.
The filename of the image. In case of kryoflux imagesany single file of the image set will do.
Needed in most cases for existing G64, G71 images. MAY CHANGE LATER.
The filename of the image. In case of kryoflux imagesany single file of the image set will do.
Tells the system you want to read a kryoflux image. You'll get a FLuxDump object.
Specifies sides to read for kryoflux image.
The filename of the image. In case of kryoflux imagesany single file of the image set will do.
Tells the system you want to read either bitstream's textual representation or a template of textual representation.
The filename of the image. In case of kryoflux imagesany single file of the image set will do.
Tells the system you want to read a sector image.
Use the factory to create the image
The filename of the image. In case of kryoflux imagesany single file of the image set will do.
Tells the system you want to read flux files, that is P64, P71, ... files.
The filename of the image. In case of kryoflux imagesany single file of the image set will do.
Tells the system you want to read an SCP image. You'll get a FLuxDump object.
The filename of the image. In case of kryoflux imagesany single file of the image set will do.
Tells the system you want to read a sector image.
Chooses the type of sector image
For sector images that can work with different number of tracks, choose the number of tracks.
Create the image from a partition table entry, that is a partition
Sets the name excluding "00.0.raw" for kryoflux image.
Tells the cmdlet you want to read bitstream images, that is G64, G71, G81, ... files.
The filename of the image. In case of kryoflux imagesany single file of the image set will do.
Tells the system you want to read flux files, that is P64, P71, ... files.
Tells the system you want to read a kryoflux image. You'll get a FLuxDump object.
Tells the system you want to read an SCP image. You'll get a FLuxDump object.
Tells the system you want to read a sector image.
Chooses the type of sector image
Specifies sides to read for kryoflux image.
Tells the system you want to read either bitstream's textual representation or a template of textual representation.
For sector images that can work with different number of tracks, choose the number of tracks.
Needed in most cases for existing G64, G71 images. MAY CHANGE LATER.
Use the factory to create the image

maml:description.maml:para: Performs maintenance and fixes on Gxx bitstream or flux images. Note the object is modified in place.
Allows padding of GCR bitstreams and fixing rotations in flux dump images. Use -Passthru to return the processed object.
Pads GCR bitstream images to have a multiple of 8 bits in length for each track
Tries to correct the Revolutions by best effort
The SCP or Kryoflux Image to process
Tries to correct the Revolutions by best effort
The SCP or Kryoflux Image to process
Pads GCR bitstream images to have a multiple of 8 bits in length for each track
